title: Yes Man Movie Poster
content:
I like the typeface, but not Jim Carrey!  
Any ideas?  
Thx!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141203200148im_/http:/typophile.com/files/YesManPoster2_5963.jpg)
author: BrooklynRob

comments.content:
Wow! What is that, a film?

Ps. Hugely expanded updated/improved Houschka family available very soon!

Nick Cooke
A Jim Carrey vehicle promises to be seen in all over the place. Congrats, Nick!

Thanks Stephen.

What is that, a film?

Der! It's in the title, idiot- Yes Man Movie poster. Another clue - Jim Carrey.

I'd just got out of bed, my brain wasn't in gear. Message to self - never post replies before coffee.

Nick Cooke

Thanks for the replies! The font design is really cool.  
(By the way, I messed up the poster to cobble together more letterform examples.  
The un-altered poster looks really nice, and can be seen here:  
 [http://yesisthenewno.warnerbros.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141203200148/http:/yesisthenewno.warnerbros.com/ "http://yesisthenewno.warnerbros.com/"))

Thanks for that Rob.

Looking good! (But I would say that wouldn't I?)

Nick Cooke

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141203200148im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Obese_4280.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141203200148im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Mednow_5928.jpg)

These pics are from a rather peculiar permanent exhibition at The Wellcome Trust on Euston Road in London. They are made out of some heavy-duty material called Corian that looks like marble. I'd love to have one of those letters.

Nick Cooke
